primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His holiness and grace through the Ark to transform David from a conventional king into a liberated worshiper.

tekstueel_bewijs: God sent a message to David
God deliberately prospers them to try to get David to see
God says, 'I will speak to you over the mercy seat'

object.identificatie: The transformation of the human heart (from slave to child/worshiper)
tekstueel_bewijs: Transforms a slave into a child
God's way of telling the world who he is
God sent a message to David and to us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Hearer identifies with the Receiver (the one needing grace).

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus was the sacrifice to end all sacrifices
the ark of the covenant has been fulfilled in the gospel of Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (through Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that 'transforms' the heart.

tekstueel_bewijs: Uzzah thinking you can manage God
Michal... understood the normal way royalty and power operated
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the fundamental human tendency to bridge the chasm to God through effort, which results in death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response of worship and service to others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (David)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Joyful worship and blessing the people
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Worship is the 'choice' that follows the 'duty' being fulfilled by Christ.

voorbeelden: the rules around the ark... were so crucial
he wants to bring the ark
you do it because you can’t wait to see the smile
The world will know what a glorious God we have
your efforts can never bridge that chasm
it’s possible for your sin to be dealt with

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (power) to save and transform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Uzzah's death) to ~S1 (Uzzah's error) to S1 (Obed-Edom and David's dance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between S1 and S2 is resolved in the 'Mercy Seat' (Christ), where holiness is satisfied and grace is released.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon explicitly rejects the idea that God is 'safe' or that sin is trivial.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently identifies God as the primary actor and the source of competence. It explicitly deconstructs moralism.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the preacher’s point was that this teaches us you have to follow all of the rules... [The speaker rejects this]

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus was the sacrifice to end all sacrifices
I was chosen by grace... I don’t have royal blood.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is not presented as a hero to imitate, but as a recipient of grace to identify with.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves David despite David's ignorance.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Liberation from the pressure of performance; joy.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (joy as a gift of the Spirit).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (God's holiness/grace) perfectly grounds the secondary program (David's worship).
spanning_punten: The 'strangeness' of Uzzah's death vs. the 'joy' of the dance.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ took all of that for us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied) provides the 'Pouvoir' to dance/worship.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; even the 'good' act of Uzzah is defiling because of the chasm of holiness.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure. God is the Subject of the salvation-verbs; the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition from 'Duty to Choice' is the perfect modal summary.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully uses the narrative of David to preach a Christocentric gospel, avoiding the trap of making David a moral hero.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'three points,' Greimas reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the Subject-switch from David's effort to God's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Ark; semiotics explains how the Ark functions as a 'concrete sermon' within the preacher's narrative world.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that Michal and Uzzah are not just characters, but actantial 'Opponents' representing the logic of 'Devoir' (Law) vs. David's 'Vouloir' (Gospel-driven desire).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Mercy Seat' as the semiotic pivot point between Judgment and Grace.
